thread.title: Critical favorite Sturgill Simpson thanked his wife and young son for his country album Grammy Award
thread.title_full: Critical favorite Sturgill Simpson thanked his wife and young son for his country album Grammy Award

author: Randy Lewis
title: Critical favorite Sturgill Simpson thanked his wife and young son for his country album Grammy Award
text:
Feb. 12, 2017, 2:44 p.m. Sturgill Simpson on accepting country album Grammy: 'I guess the revolution won't be televised' Randy Lewis (Allen J. Schaben / Los Angeles Times) 
Accepting his pre-telecast Grammy Award for country album for his critically acclaimed "A Sailor's Guide to Earth" collection, Kentucky-born singer, songwriter and producer Sturgill Simpson said, "Like six years ago, I was in Utah working on the railroad, writing songs at night. 
"My wife made me quit that job and move to Nashville, so thanks babe. My son was born; I spent that spent first year on the road, missing them, and if it wasn’t for them I wouldn’t have written this album, so I have to thank them. 
“And I guess the revolution won’t be televised,” he said. “Thank you.” Latest updates
